result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Jay Marten

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam Jay Marten in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Adam Jay Marten in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 14CF239 & 15CM273  @ 2:38 pm.  State gives plea agreement, Ct 5 First Degree Sexual Assault of Child, repeater, Ct's 1-4 & 6-7 DRI, 15CM273 DRI. 15 years prison 5 year initial confinement 10 extended supervision, Life time Registry and GPS monitoring.   Complied with victim rights. No PSI requested. Defense memorandum filed.  Atty Schuster filed with Judge not court. Atty Schuster agrees this is a  Joint recommendation.  Recess @ 2:42 pm. Back on the record @ 2:46 pm.  Court has found Memorandum and has reviewed it.  Atty Schuster and def. agree with plea agreement. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charge and penalties.  Ct 5 - First Degree Child Sex Assault, repeater no contest plea.  DRI ct's 1-4 6 & 7 in 14CF239 & ct 1 in 15CM273   Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. admits prior convictions.  Def. agrees. Def. understands elements.  Atty Schuster is satisfied. Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Ct 5 1st degree Child Sex Assault under Age 13, repeater under 948.02(1)(e) and 939.62(1)(a).  State gives sentencing arguments.  Atty Schuster agrees joint recommendation.  734 days credit. Def. has nothing to say.  Atty Schuster replys.  State gives argument.  Court orders on ct 5 Extended supervision Conditions Life time Sex Offender Registry and Life time GPS monitoring, costs, 250 DNA surcharge and DNA sample, No contact with BCW,  AODA by agent and complete follow through, Counseling deemed by agent, No unsupervised contact with minors. No use of alcohol or illegal controlled substance.  Court will agree with joint recommendation
15 years prison, 5 years initial confinement and 10 years extended supervision, 734 days credit.  
Def is not eligible for Challenge.  Def. is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  Def. advised of firearm and voting rights. Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Court calls 14CF239 & 15CM273  @ 11:12 am.  Defendant Adam Jay Marten in court, in custody and via-video with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has not complied with victim rights.  Judge gives statement on age of case.  State and Atty Schuster gives reason.  Court will adjourn.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Adam Jay Marten in court via video with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Adam Jay Marten in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Not guilty plea entered.  Court will receive not guilty plea.  Bond will continue.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Adam Jay Marten in court, via video in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  New complaint, def does not have copy.  Copy will be provided.  Court read charge with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.   State request cash bond.   Off record for Judge to check CCAP.  Back on record.  Statement by Court.  Bond set by Court  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
